frameDefinitions: A Speaker addresses an Audience on a particular Topic.
The Creator creates a new entity, the Created_entity, possibly out of Components.

A Communicator speaks to an Addressee in such a way that the Addressee understands and fully appreciates the truth and/or relevance of the Message.   ' Marred by overblown writing , this first novel by Wilbur Smith 's wife effectively conveys some of South Africa 's problems .
An Ingestor consumes food or drink (Ingestibles), which entails putting the Ingestibles in the mouth for delivery to the digestive system.
An Offerer indicates that he or she is able and willing to give a Theme to a Potential_recipient.
This frame contains verbs and nouns that communicate the act of a Speaker to address a Message to some Addressee using language.
frameExamples: McNamara <t>addressed</t> congress on the state of affairs of the Department of Defense.
The Libyans were <t>generating</t> arms for export.
Marred by overblown writing , this first novel by Wilbur Smith 's wife effectively <t>conveys</t> some of South Africa 's problems .INI
The host graciously <t>offered</t> us food and drink.
I now <t>declare</t> you members of this Society.
listRoleDefinitions: The person or persons to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> delivers their text.
The person who orally delivers a text about a <fen>Topic</fen> to a passive <fen>Audience</fen>.
What the text that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces is about.
The <fen>Time</fen> describes when the speaking occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> describes the location where the speaking occurs.
The Creator creates a created entity.
This role identifies the entity that the Agent intentionally creates.
This role identifes the Time when an Agent intentionally creates a new entity.
This role identifies the place ehere the Agent intentionally creates the new entity.
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a <fen>Message</fen> to another person.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> receives a <fen>Message</fen> from the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
<fen>Message</fen> A proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to believe or take for granted.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The time at which the communication takes place.
The <fen>Ingestor</fen> is the person eating or drinking.
The <fen>Ingestibles</fen> are the entities that are being consumed by the <fen>Ingestor</fen>.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and offers it to the <fen>Potential_recipient</fen> .
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object which is offered for transfer.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Offerer</fen> offers the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Potential_recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Offerer</fen> offers the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Potential_recipient</fen>.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen> (whether spoken or written).  It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target	</t> word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the role that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about', but in some cases it can appear as a direct object.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is made.
The role specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> takes place.
listRoleExamples: He lectured <fex>to the officers of the Scots Guard</fex>  in  1929.
<fex>You</fex> have to sermonize about the good times
He was the Director: he could lecture <fex>on whomever he liked</fex>.
<fex>Nobody</fex> seems to be able to get the idea through to her that she needs a job!!!!

According to Masztalics, a good teacher uses experiments to get the point across
<fex>to the class</fex>.
He tried to get through to his wife <fex>that the debt he's taken on buying stocks poses no risk</fex>.
<fex>The article</fex> conveys Mr. Handley's disrespect for those who disagree with him.
Greenspan got his point across <fex>yesterday</fex> that a measured pace of rate hikes is still the plan.
Evelyn said <fex>that she was not ready to leave</fex>.
Kim preached to me <fex>over the phone</fex>.
In some remarks <fex>at the National Press Club</fex>, Mr. Keating said he would make a better prime minister tha nMr. Hawke.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Indian Council of Agriculture Research
The Women and Child Development Ministry
The Third World Academy of Sciences Award
